I think the most important skills scientist need for the future is the ability to visualize how their research in the lab can apply to the real world. It is also called “Big Picture Thinking” . Our world needs more real world inventions that can solve the big challenges of environment, fossil fuels, pollution etc . While we have several conceptual solutions in the lab the ability to practically apply it at scale and in a cost-effective way is the real solution So, “Big Picture Thinking”, that is, visualizing a practical solution is the key skill
